Anonymous Fri 25 Aug 2017 03:50:43 No.11201096 Report
Quoted By: >>11202551
>>11194844
I have a point of criticism here, hope you don't mind.

This story is too perfect. Not perfectly written, but the events that happen to our dear Anon are 95% perfect. There's a lack of conflict. Early on we get the idea that human/anthro relations are not perfect. Anon doesn't give a shit. This would be a lot of fun, but it's never hard for him to not give a shit. He smashes through the concept of conflict without any effort. Later we find that Clara's parents may not like their relationship. Anon is a war hero (which I appreciate, it's not something that gets the attention that it used to) and he just brushes aside any resistance with no effort. Not only is anon a war hero, with very minor PTSD, a can do can't be bothered attitude, and a physically fit body, he's also really well off which is odd for a soldier even if he is collecting disability and dumped his parents' capital into investments before enlisting.

Now we get to the point where his house burns down. Oh good, I thought, now something crappy is happening to Anon that will actually take some effort to overcome. Nope. Solved while not even in Anon's perspective.

Maybe it's just me liking main characters that suffer through things a lot, but this whole thing seems like it's too easy. I'm not even suggesting that you change it, making the piece have more problems to face would change the tone in a way that may not work. Just my two cents, take it or leave it as you will.
